headline: Verizon Reports Earnings. 4 Reasons the Stock Is Rising Sharply.
summary: The wireless carrier posts better-than-expected earnings and adds more postpaid customers than expected in the fourth quarter.

headline: Verizon Earnings Beat; 2026 Profit Outlook Above Views Amid $25 Billion Buy Back
summary: Verizon stock climbed amid 2026 profit guidance that came in above views under a new CEO. Q4 earnings, revenue and wireless subscriber adds beat.

headline: Benchmark Names T-Mobile (TMUS) a 2026 Best Idea
summary: T-Mobile US Inc. (NASDAQ:TMUS) ranks among the most promising QQQ stocks according to hedge funds. On January 21, Benchmark reaffirmed its Buy rating on T-Mobile US Inc. (NASDAQ:TMUS) with a $295 price target, classifying the telecom provider as a “2026 Benchmark Best Idea.” The firm remains confident that T-Mobile’s network strengths and potential for expanded […]

headline: Verizon Posts Strong Subscriber Gains Under New CEO
summary: Verizon Communications  gained a net 616,000 postpaid phone connections in the fourth quarter, with its chief executive calling the period a “critical inflection point.”  Dan Schulman  took over as chief executive officer of the nation’s largest wireless carrier in October with a mandate to execute cost cuts and a strategic turnaround after it lost ground to rivals.  This month he faced a major test as millions of Verizon customers lost service during an hourslong network outage.
